Headline: Between Chapters
Comment:
100%. We're blindly chasing productivity and escaping the functioning of the human body. However, the study was conducted between 2000 and 2022. I'm not sure if this reflects the status quo and whether the data collected during COVID times affects this number to an extreme.

But, regardless of the questions around the study and how the statistics look today, extreme inactivity is fatal, and we're seeing an increasing number of untimely deaths amongst the younger populations. 

We really need to take our health as seriously as we've taken social media and GenAI.

Headline: Financial Crime Global Leader (AML/CTF/KYC) | CI, Transformation & Client Advisory | Global Process Owner
Comment:
Story of money and health :

We work for money. 
But we sit as hell to make money. 
Then we use this money to trigger instant harmonal rush by binge eating. 
We eat from packets or eat outside.  
We also use gadgets to further relax our bums. 
And then we all have cars to drive to work or leisure.  We have elevators. 
We have coffee machines on each floor.  
We try to be productive. 
Some people eat at their desks as they cannot waste a single minute. 

No walking only sitting. 

And finally one day, we use the same money on hospitals.  

The sad part is when we are in this process of gradual daily deterioration of our health, we don‚Äôt have any RAG or KPI meter to let us know that :-

-Life reduced by 1 day, Status Amber. 

Or 

-Total number of Lifedays remaining: 5506 (-10% from last months average). Status RED 
/!\ Warning : At this rate, you would die 10 years before the average life span.
processed_comment: story of money and health we work for money but we sit as hell to make money then we use this money to trigger instant harmonal rush by binge eating we eat from packets or eat outside we also use gadgets to further relax our bums and then we all have cars to drive to work or leisure we have elevators we have coffee machines on each floor we try to be productive some people eat at their desks as they cannot waste a single minute no walking only sitting and finally one day we use the same money on hospitals the sad part is when we are in this process of gradual daily deterioration of our health we dont have any rag or kpi meter to let us know that life reduced by day status amber or total number of lifedays remaining from last months average status red warning at this rate you would die years before the average life span

India's water, food, sanitation and other supply chains need a re-look. Lancet study would have simply provided an over simplified suggestion but the problem needs more deeper analysis. The benefits should be available to the last of the common man for this to be solved.
